lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Import the App.css file.

Make sure to pick import, followed by "./App.css", and finally ;.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which file would you use to apply global styles to your entire React app?

App.cssHeader.cssindex.jsxindex.html

Make sure to pick App.css.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the correct CSS class to apply the defined rule from the UserProfile.css file.

Make sure to pick className, followed by =, and finally "userProfile".

lessons.title: Lesson #1 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the correct CSS class to the div to apply the defined CSS rule in Square.css.

Make sure to type "square".

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Do the two CSS rules in the App.css file make sense?

Yes, as they are general rules targeting elementsNo, they should move into a more specific CSS fileNo, we must not define any CSS rules in the App.css fileNo, as we should define general CSS rules in the index.css file

Yes, as they are general rules targeting elements.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Do we need to include the index.css file when using React even though we are not using it actively?

Yes, as the bundler requires this import statementNo, if we don't use it, we don't need itYes, but we should use itNo, including it would be a mistake

Yes, as the bundler requires this import statement.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the correct property to apply inline styling to the div.

Make sure to pick style.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is true about how React handles the style property?

It uses a JavaScript object instead of a stringIt uses a string like HTMLIt always expects a single styling ruleStylings must be applied in a CSS file

It uses a JavaScript object instead of a string.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Check if the passed property size equals "small" to dynamically set the width and height of the div element.

Make sure to pick props.size, followed by ===.

lessons.title: Lesson #1 - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's missing in the HTML code that is prohibiting the CSS from being rendered?

Importing the index.css file that the React bundler requiresNothing, the CSS is applied correctlyImporting the App componentImporting the App.css file

Importing the index.css file that the React bundler requires.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Given the following code, what will be the background color of all div elements?

YellowBlueRedGreen

Make sure to pick Yellow.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the CSS class to make the rule in the Header.css file target the h1 element in the Header component.

Make sure to pick className followed by = and then ", main-header, ".

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
If you want to apply styles only to the ProductList component, where should you import the ProductList.css file?

ProductList.jsxApp.cssApp.jsxindex.css

Make sure to pick ProductList.jsx.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does className attribute in React replace from regular HTML?

classidstylediv

Make sure to pick class.

lessons.title: Lesson #1 - Copy - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a rule for the class defined in the Box component.

Make sure to type .box.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's implement a styled button for a "Gryffindor" greeting.

Make sure to pick style followed by { and then {, color: "gold",, backgroundColor: "red", }, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the styles variable describe?

A JavaScript object that defines stylesA CSS stylesheet fileA string of CSS rulesAn array of style names

A JavaScript object that defines styles.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement styles for the HobbitCard component.

Make sure to pick cardStyle followed by style and then =, {, cardStyle, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use the passed property color to style the box on the fly.

Make sure to pick props, followed by ., and finally color.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What property is used to apply custom styles to a React component?

styleclassiddata

Make sure to pick style.

lessons.title: Lesson #1 - Copy
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to make the React code work with CSS files.

Remember that we need to reference index.css for the bundler to work despite not using it.

Make sure to pick rel, followed by "./index.css".
